channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: TikTok bans #SkinnyTok. But content promoting unhealthy eating persists
item.description: The social media platform TikTok recently banned a hashtag called #SkinnyTok after European regulators warned it was promoting extreme weight loss. But eliminating this kind of content is not easy.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: President Trump announced on Monday that Iran and Israel have agreed to a ceasefire, the U.S. Supreme Court allows third-country deportations temporarily, voting is underway in hotly contested New York City mayoral Democratic primary.

item.title: Trump announces a ceasefire between Israel and Iran
item.description: President Trump announced on social media on Monday that Iran and Israel had agreed to a ceasefire. That's after the U.S. got directly involved over the weekend striking key nuclear sites in Iran.

item.title: Rep. Jim Himes says he learned about U.S. attack on Iran on social media
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin asks Rep. Jim Himes of Connecticut, top Democrat on the House Intelligence committee, about the Iranian attack on a U.S. airbase in Qatar.

item.title: How hot is too hot for kids?
item.description: With heat indices over 100 degrees across much of the country, it's hot out there. But is it too hot for kids to be outside?

item.title: In 'Trailblazer' Carol Moseley Braun talks about the high cost of being the first
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with former U.S. Senator, Carol Moseley Braun, about her new memoir, "Trailblazer."

item.title: Sean Combs' defense is about to get its day in court. Here's what to expect
item.description: For weeks, federal prosecutors have laid out their case against Sean Combs in a Manhattan courtroom. His attorneys should begin presenting their defense on Tuesday. They aren't expected to take long.

item.title: Salvadoran journalist's arrest in Georgia sets 'alarming precedent'
item.description: Salvadoran journalist Mario Guevara is currently in Immigration and Customs Enforcement custody. The Committee to Protect Journalists warns his case represents an "erosion" of freedom of speech.

item.title: An announced ceasefire between Israel and Iran remains uncertain
item.description: President Trump announced a ceasefire between Israel and Iran on Monday. But despite separate statements from the two countries saying they agreed to a truce, reports persisted of further airstrikes.

item.title: Will Israel-Iran ceasefire hold? Analyst says both sides have strong incentives
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin asks the Atlantic Council's Jonathan Panikoff whether a ceasefire agreement will stick between two countries that have spent decades antagonizing each other, Israel and Iran.
